name: NPR
text:
President Trump declared himself "a law-and-order president" as he delivered remarks in opposition to the ongoing demonstrations, describing the unrest as "acts of domestic terrorism."
https://t.co/2uZ0GYgAxS

name: NPR
text:
“I think at the time of the Rodney King beating it was easier to view it as an isolated incident or as a few bad apples,” says USC law professor Jody David Armour.

“But now, over time, we see a persistent and pervasive pattern.” https://t.co/cu9XaZxRMy

name: NPR
text: "It's not just about one or two instances. ... We continually are separated from American society. We're treated as if we're less than." Black demonstrators told @CapRadioNews about why these protests are important to them. https://t.co/N3uwulvM5G

name: NPR
text:
George Floyd’s death was ruled a homicide, according to a new official autopsy report.

The medical examiner said Floyd's heart and lungs stopped functioning "while being restrained" by police.
https://t.co/oqV4KKYNst

name: NPR
text: Adm. Brett Giroir will be "demobilized" from his role overseeing coronavirus testing in mid-June and going back to his regular job at the Department of Health and Human Services. https://t.co/KYxXeb8Hd2

name: NPR
text:
President Trump threatened to deploy the military to states that don't quell violent protests.

But to do that, he would need to invoke what's known as the Insurrection Act of 1807.
https://t.co/z9PLOI07iu
